perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop and distribute until December 31, 2006. For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee's right and license to develop and distribute the Game in connection with the Property "ICE AGE 2" shall become non-exclusive after December 31, 2006.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop and distribute until December 31, 2006. Licensee's right and license to develop and distribute the Game in connection with the Property "ICE AGE 2" shall remain exclusive indefinitely, notwithstanding the previous sentence.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states the game license becomes non-exclusive after a specific date. The modified text contradicts this by stating the game license remains exclusive indefinitely, creating a direct conflict regarding the exclusivity of the game license after December 31, 2006. This could lead to disputes about who has the right to distribute the game after that date.

perturbation.original_text: Fox hereby reserves the right to distribute all Wireless Products through Fox's direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for which Fox shall retain a Distribution Fee as defined in Paragraph 4(a) of this Amendment. (a) DISTRIBUTION FEE FOR DIRECT-TO-CONSUMER DISTRIBUTION: Should Fox or its assigns choose to distribute the Wireless Products through Fox's and its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, Fox or its assigns shall deduct a percentage of Fox's Gross Receipts (defined as monies received by or credited to Fox or its assigns from Fox's or its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for the download of the Wireless Products by end users, or the sale or download of Wireless Products to end users) collected from the sale of such Wireless Products ("Distribution Fee") in the amount of ***** percent (*****%) of Fox's Gross Receipts.
perturbation.changed_text: Fox hereby reserves the right to distribute all Wireless Products through Fox's direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for which Fox shall retain a Distribution Fee as defined in Paragraph 4(a) of this Amendment. (a) DISTRIBUTION FEE FOR DIRECT-TO-CONSUMER DISTRIBUTION: Should Fox or its assigns choose to distribute the Wireless Products through Fox's and its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, Fox or its assigns shall deduct a percentage of Fox's Gross Receipts (defined as monies received by or credited to Fox or its assigns from Fox's or its assigns' direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for the download of the Wireless Products by end users, or the sale or download of Wireless Products to end users) collected from the sale of such Wireless Products ("Distribution Fee"). Fox shall not deduct any Distribution Fee from its Gross Receipts.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a distribution fee and sets its amount. The modified text contradicts this by stating that Fox shall not deduct any distribution fee at all, creating conflicting instructions regarding whether a distribution fee should be applied. This creates an internal contradiction on the monetary compensation related to distribution rights.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, Fox retains the right to develop and distribute promotional KOH Video Clips for the purpose of marketing the Property and DVD, which shall consist of different video clips than those developed for Licensee's distribution. Licensee's term of exclusivity with respect to the KOH Video Clips shall expire on October 29, 2005, and Licensee's right and license to distribute the KOH Video Clips shall expire twelve (12) months after the initial theatrical release of the Property "KINGDOM OF HEAVEN".
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, Fox retains the right to develop and distribute promotional KOH Video Clips for the purpose of marketing the Property and DVD, which shall consist of the same video clips as those developed for Licensee's distribution. Licensee's term of exclusivity with respect to the KOH Video Clips shall expire on October 29, 2005, and Licensee's right and license to distribute the KOH Video Clips shall continue indefinitely after the initial theatrical release of the Property "KINGDOM OF HEAVEN".
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that Fox's promotional video clips must be different and Licensee's distribution rights expire 12 months after theatrical release. The modified text directly contradicts these, by saying that Fox promotional material may use the same video clips and Licensee's distribution rights will continue indefinitely. The nature of promotional materials and the longevity of distribution rights are now uncertain.
